resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
In principio erat V[erbum] (In the beginning was the V[erb]).
These are the first words from the Gospel of John.
resource.chars:
In principio erat V[erbum] (In the beginning was the V[erb]).

These are the first words from the Gospel of John.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M2495.71132,1776.88737h349.09012v0h349.09012v-64.13967v-64.13967h-349.09012h-349.09012v64.13967z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":3,"rotation":0,"deleteIcon":null,"rotationIcon":null,"group":null,"editable":true,"annotation":null}" id="rectangle_8cf104c2-5444-4859-a478-eeace9b24fdd" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#008000" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Ioh anni an te
homi nis
The letters in red have both a meaning between them and with the other grey letters of the poem. Here, we can read Iohannis (of John) in red, thus identifying him, and ... Iohanni ante ... (... to John before ...) ... hominis ... (... of a man ...).
resource.chars:
Ioh anni an te

homi nis

The letters in red have both a meaning between them and with the other grey letters of the poem. Here, we can read Iohannis (of John) in red, thus identifying him, and ... Iohanni ante ... (... to John before ...) ... hominis ... (... of a man ...).

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Vox clamantis [in deserto] (Yelling voice in the desert).
This is the third verse from the Gospel of Mark, used to identify him as a lion.
resource.chars:
Vox clamantis [in deserto] (Yelling voice in the desert).

This is the third verse from the Gospel of Mark, used to identify him as a lion.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Mat the us
fir mat i us
Same as John above, the letters in red are identifying Matthew and they're set to have sense with grey letters.

fir mat i us
